content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-037-12-B |Item_parent=Voluntary termination of pregnancy |Item_parent_short=Voluntary termination of pregnancy |Rank=B |Title=Identifying risk factors for recidivism |Description=None |Rubric=Follow-up and/or prognosis |Contributors=Arthur Foulon,Philippe Deruelle,Aubert Agostini |Order=12}} The risk factors for repeat abortions are : - young age - single patient - unfavourable socio-economic conditions (difficult economic access to contraception, lack of information) - unsuitable contraception Long-acting reversible contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices and implants could help prevent repeat abortions. Efforts must also be made to detect past or ongoing violence.
